results.title: An Indigenous Canadian Director Channels Traumatic Memories Into Film
results.abstract: Tracey Deer based “Beans” on her experiences as a child during the 1990 Oka crisis, a confrontation between the Mohawk people and the government.

multimedia.caption: “My biggest wish back then and even today is to be seen, to be heard, to be understood,” Tracey Deer said.
multimedia.copyright: Guoman Liao for The New York Times

results.title: Kristen Stewart’s Princess Diaries
results.abstract: The actress is drawing Oscar talk for her portrayal of Princess Diana in “Spencer,” a role that required the sort of performance she had never given before.

multimedia.caption: “I used to think that I needed spontaneity and anxiety to propel me into something truthful,” Kristen Stewart said of her acting evolution.

results.title: When Women Filmmakers Get to Tell Their Origin Stories
results.abstract: Movies about men who make movies are common, but female auteurs don’t often get such chances. That’s just one reason two new releases are so surprising.

results.title: Lawyers for ‘Rust’ Armorer Say Gun Was Briefly Unattended Before Shooting
results.abstract: The weapon handed to Alec Baldwin was left on a tray for several minutes, said the lawyers. Earlier, they had said it had been unattended for hours.

multimedia.caption: Lawyers for the armorer, who administered guns on the set of “Rust,” a film to star Alec Baldwin, said that the gun that fatally discharged on the set was left unattended for five to ten minutes.
